citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live rabbits.
citations.narrative:
Under IACUC protocol 23-2, rabbits are transported by the registrant to a separate facility for surgery. The rabbits are
transported to this site using unmarked carriers. Transport carriers must be clearly marked with the words "Live Animal"
on top and on one or more sides, in letters not less than 2.5 centimeters in height, and must bare arrows or markings
indicating the correct upright position of the carrier. Unmarked carriers may expose rabbits to injury risk in handling during
transport. The facility must address these requirements.
Correct by 6/20/24 or before future transport.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.61(f) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live rabbits. 
Under IACUC protocol 23-2, rabbits are transported by the registrant to a separate facility for surgery. The rabbits are 
transported to this site using unmarked carriers. Transport carriers must be clearly marked with the words "Live Animal" 
on top and on one or more sides, in letters not less than 2.5 centimeters in height, and must bare arrows or markings 
indicating the correct upright position of the carrier. Unmarked carriers may expose rabbits to injury risk in handling during 
transport. The facility must address these requirements.  
 
Correct by 6/20/24 or before future transport. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
